title: SEE 2081 English Practice Test 1
subject: english
instructionsEnglish: Candidates are required to answer the questions in their own words as far as practicable. Figures in the margin indicate the full marks. Attempt all the questions.

questions.title: Read the poem and do the tasks.

passage.title: IF
passage.author: Rudyard Kipling
passage.content:
If you can keep your head when all about you
Are losing theirs and blaming it on you,
If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you,
But make allowance for their doubting too;
If you can wait and not be tired by waiting,
Or being lied about, don’t deal in lies,
Or being hated, don’t give way to hating,
And yet don’t look too good, nor talk too wise:

If you can dream—and not make dreams your master;
If you can think—and not make thoughts your aim;
If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster
And treat those two impostors just the same;
If you can bear to hear the truth you’ve spoken
Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools,
Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken,
And stoop and build ’em up with worn-out tools:

subSections.title: Write ‘TRUE’ for true and ‘FALSE’ for the false statements.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poem advises us to lose our temper when others are blaming us.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको पहिलो पङ्क्तिले "If you can keep your head when all about you / Are losing theirs and blaming it on you" भन्छ, जसको अर्थ हो, अरूले दोष दिँदा पनि शान्त रहनुपर्छ, आफ्नो रिस गुमाउनु हुँदैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first line of the poem says, "If you can keep your head when all about you / Are losing theirs and blaming it on you," which means one should remain calm and not lose their temper even when being blamed by others. Citations: chapter 16, page 266.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to the poet, we should not hate those who hate us.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले "Or being hated, don’t give way to hating" भन्छ, जसको अर्थ हो कि घृणा गर्नेहरूलाई पनि घृणा गर्नु हुँदैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem states, "Or being hated, don’t give way to hating," which directly advises not to hate those who hate you. Citations: chapter 16, page 266.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poet suggests that we should treat success and failure differently.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले "If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster / And treat those two impostors just the same" भन्छ, जसको अर्थ हो कि सफलता (Triumph) र असफलता (Disaster) दुवैलाई समान रूपमा व्यवहार गर्नुपर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem advises to "meet with Triumph and Disaster / And treat those two impostors just the same," meaning that success (Triumph) and failure (Disaster) should be treated equally. Citations: chapter 16, pages 266-267.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Dishonest people might misinterpret the words we have spoken.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कवितामा "If you can bear to hear the truth you’ve spoken / Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools" उल्लेख छ, जहाँ 'knaves' को अर्थ बेइमान मानिसहरू हो। यसले देखाउँछ कि बेइमान मानिसहरूले हाम्रो सत्यलाई गलत रूपमा प्रस्तुत गर्न सक्छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem mentions, "If you can bear to hear the truth you’ve spoken / Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools," where 'knaves' are dishonest people. This indicates that dishonest people might twist our truths. Citations: chapter 16, page 267.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poem suggests that it is wise to give up when our creations are destroyed.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले "Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken, / And stoop and build ’em up with worn-out tools" भन्छ, जसको अर्थ हो कि हाम्रो सिर्जना नष्ट भए पनि, हामीले हार मान्नु हुँदैन र पुरानै साधनले फेरि बनाउन प्रयास गर्नुपर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem advises to "watch the things you gave your life to, broken, / And stoop and build ’em up with worn-out tools," meaning we should not give up but try to rebuild our creations even when they are destroyed. Citations: chapter 16, page 267.

questions.title: Read the text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Cyber Security: Basic Internet Safety Tips
passage.content:
Modern life is fundamentally intertwined with the internet. Nearly every daily task now has the opportunity for online integration, and almost everyone owns multiple devices, including laptops, phones, tablets, and smartwatches. The more accounts and devices you have online, the greater the potential is for criminals to access your personal information and take advantage of you.

Online safety is important no matter your age or life stage, but there are particular concerns for certain vulnerable groups like children, teenagers, and senior citizens. When it comes to internet safety, it's best to start with the basics. Here are some tips to guide you.

While creating a new password, pay attention to strong password requirements. Use different user IDs or password combinations for different accounts. Make the password more complicated by combining letters, numbers, and special characters and create hard-to-guess passwords. Change your passwords quite often. Don't share your passwords with other people. Record passwords in an encrypted file on your computer, or select another secure password storage method. Avoid writing them down. Prevent "auto-login" by unchecking "Keep me signed in" and "Remember my password" options.

It's also important to protect your personal information offline. Remember tips like shielding the personal identification number (PIN) pad when you make purchases. Using a chip debit card is another way to protect your financial information. The more sophisticated chip technology is just one reason why the chip card is more secure than the traditional magnetic strip debit card. When you sign up for something online, always read the terms and conditions. Never enter your financial information on a website that is not secure.

Finally, enable two-factor authentication in order to prevent hackers from accessing your personal accounts and information. Add the extra layer of security to keep your accounts safe even if someone knows your password.

subSections.title: Fill in the blanks with the correct information from the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Our daily lives are deeply connected with the __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: internet
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको पहिलो वाक्यमा "Modern life is fundamentally intertwined with the internet" भनिएको छ, जसको अर्थ आधुनिक जीवन इन्टरनेटसँग गहिरो रूपमा जोडिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first sentence of the text states, "Modern life is fundamentally intertwined with the internet," meaning modern life is deeply connected with the internet. Citations: chapter 7, page 115.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Groups such as children and __________ are particularly at risk online.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: teenagers/senior citizens
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले उल्लेख गर्दछ कि "there are particular concerns for certain vulnerable groups like children, teenagers and senior citizens," जसको अर्थ हो कि बालबालिका, किशोरकिशोरी र ज्येष्ठ नागरिकहरू अनलाइनमा विशेष जोखिममा छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions that "there are particular concerns for certain vulnerable groups like children, teenagers and senior citizens," indicating these groups are at risk. Citations: chapter 7, page 115.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: To make a password stronger, one should combine letters, numbers, and __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: special characters
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा पासवर्डलाई "combining letters, numbers, and special characters" द्वारा थप जटिल बनाउन सुझाव दिइएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text suggests making a password more complicated by "combining letters, numbers, and special characters." Citations: chapter 7, page 115.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: A debit card with __________ technology is safer than one with a magnetic strip.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: chip
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि "The more sophisticated chip technology is just one reason why the chip card is more secure than the traditional magnetic strip debit card."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "The more sophisticated chip technology is just one reason why the chip card is more secure than the traditional magnetic strip debit card." Citations: chapter 7, page 116.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: An extra layer of security can be added by enabling __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: two-factor authentication
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको अन्तिम अनुच्छेदमा "Enable two-factor authentication in order to prevent hackers from accessing your personal accounts" भनेर उल्लेख गरिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The final paragraph of the text mentions to "Enable two-factor authentication in order to prevent hackers from accessing your personal accounts." Citations: chapter 7, page 116.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why is there a greater risk of criminals accessing personal information today?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: There is a greater risk because almost everyone owns multiple online accounts and devices.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ, "The more accounts and devices you have online, the greater the potential is for criminals to access your personal information."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "The more accounts and devices you have online, the greater the potential is for criminals to access your personal information." Citations: chapter 7, page 115.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is one way to keep your passwords private and secure?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: One way is to record passwords in an encrypted file on your computer and not share them with others.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले सुझाव दिन्छ, "Record passwords in an encrypted file on your computer" र "Don't share your passwords with other people."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text suggests to "Record passwords in an encrypted file on your computer" and "Don't share your passwords with other people." Citations: chapter 7, page 115.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to the text, what should you do before signing up for an online service?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: You should always read the terms and conditions.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले सल्लाह दिन्छ, "When you sign up for something online, always read the terms and conditions."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text advises, "When you sign up for something online, always read the terms and conditions." Citations: chapter 7, page 116.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How can you protect your PIN when making a purchase?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: You can protect your PIN by shielding the PIN pad when you make purchases.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले "shielding the personal identification number (PIN) pad when you make purchases" लाई एउटा उपायको रूपमा उल्लेख गरेको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions "shielding the personal identification number (PIN) pad when you make purchases" as a method of protection. Citations: chapter 7, page 116.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the main purpose of two-factor authentication?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Its main purpose is to prevent hackers from accessing your personal accounts.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि टु-फ्याक्टर अथेन्टिकेसनले "prevent hackers from accessing your personal accounts and information" मा मद्दत गर्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states that two-factor authentication helps to "prevent hackers from accessing your personal accounts and information." Citations: chapter 7, page 116.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Vacancy Announcement
passage.content:
A well-established national NGO working in the field of public health is looking for dynamic and self-motivated Nepali citizens for the following positions for its new project in the rural municipalities of Sindhuli district.

1. Position: Field Officer
- Required Number: 2
- Required Qualification: At least Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, or a related field.
- Experience: Minimum 2 years of experience in community mobilization and project implementation.
- Skills: Excellent communication and reporting skills in both English and Nepali. Must have a valid motorcycle license and be willing to travel extensively in rural areas.

2. Position: Finance Assistant
- Required Number: 1
- Required Qualification: At least Intermediate level (+2) in Management/Commerce.
- Experience: Experience in a similar role will be an added advantage.
- Skills: Good knowledge of accounting software, MS Excel, and bookkeeping. Should be detail-oriented and organized.

Interested candidates who meet the above criteria are requested to send their application along with an updated CV to vacancy.health@ngo.org.np by 30th March, 2025.

*Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview. Telephone inquiries will not be entertained. The organization reserves the right to reject any or all applications without assigning any reason whatsoever.*

subSections.title: Write 'TRUE' for true, 'FALSE' for false, or 'NOT GIVEN' if the information is not in the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The NGO is an international organization.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनाले स्पष्ट रूपमा "A well-established national NGO" भनेको छ, जसको अर्थ यो एक राष्ट्रिय गैर-सरकारी संस्था हो, अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The announcement clearly states, "A well-established national NGO," which means it is a national non-governmental organization, not an international one. Citations: chapter 4, page 59.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The project is located in the urban areas of Sindhuli.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ कि परियोजना "rural municipalities of Sindhuli district" मा छ, शहरी क्षेत्रमा होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text specifies that the project is in the "rural municipalities of Sindhuli district," not urban areas. Citations: chapter 17, page 288.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: A motorcycle license is mandatory for the Finance Assistant position.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: NOT GIVEN
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले फिल्ड अफिसरको लागि मोटरसाइकल लाइसेन्स अनिवार्य छ भनेको छ, तर फाइनान्स असिस्टेन्टको लागि यस्तो आवश्यकता उल्लेख गरिएको छैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions that a motorcycle license is mandatory for the Field Officer, but no such requirement is mentioned for the Finance Assistant position. Citations: chapter 4, page 60.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The organization will contact all applicants to inform them of their status.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा भनिएको छ, "Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview," जसको अर्थ हो कि सर्टलिस्टमा परेका उम्मेदवारहरूलाई मात्र सम्पर्क गरिनेछ, सबैलाई होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice says, "Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview," which means that only the candidates who are shortlisted will be contacted, not all applicants. Citations: chapter 4, page 60.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Candidates can call the office to ask about their application.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सूचनामा स्पष्ट रूपमा "Telephone inquiries will not be entertained" भनिएको छ, जसको अर्थ हो कि फोनमा सोधपुछ गर्न पाइने छैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The notice explicitly states, "Telephone inquiries will not be entertained," meaning candidates should not call the office for inquiries. Citations: chapter 4, page 59.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What kind of organization is advertising the vacancy?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: A well-established national NGO working in the field of public health is advertising the vacancy.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको सुरुमा "A well-established national NGO working in the field of public health" भनेर संस्थाको परिचय दिइएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The beginning of the text introduces the organization as "A well-established national NGO working in the field of public health." Citations: chapter 4, page 59.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the minimum academic qualification for the post of Field Officer?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The minimum academic qualification is a Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, or a related field.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: फिल्ड अफिसर पदको लागि "Required Qualification" अन्तर्गत "At least Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, or a related field" उल्लेख गरिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: Under the "Required Qualification" for the Field Officer post, it is mentioned, "At least Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, Social Work, or a related field." Citations: chapter 4, page 60.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How many vacancies are there in total?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: There are three vacancies in total (2 for Field Officer and 1 for Finance Assistant).
subQuestions.explanationNepali: फिल्ड अफिसरको लागि "Required Number: 2" र फाइनान्स असिस्टेन्टको लागि "Required Number: 1" उल्लेख छ, जसको जम्मा ३ हुन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: It is mentioned "Required Number: 2" for Field Officer and "Required Number: 1" for Finance Assistant, which totals 3. Citations: chapter 4, page 60.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What skill is required for the Finance Assistant role?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Good knowledge of accounting software, MS Excel, and bookkeeping is required.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: फाइनान्स असिस्टेन्ट पदको "Skills" खण्डमा "Good knowledge of accounting software, MS Excel, and bookkeeping" उल्लेख गरिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: In the "Skills" section for the Finance Assistant post, "Good knowledge of accounting software, MS Excel, and bookkeeping" is mentioned. Citations: chapter 4, page 60.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How should interested candidates apply for the positions?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Interested candidates should send their application and an updated CV to the provided email address.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा आवेदन दिनका लागि "send their application along with an updated CV to vacancy.health@ngo.org.np" भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text instructs candidates to "send their application along with an updated CV to vacancy.health@ngo.org.np." Citations: chapter 4, page 60.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: A Healthy Diet for a Healthy Life
passage.content:
It’s a topic that’s never out of the media, with endless variations on whether carbs, fat, sugar or protein are good or bad, or reports on the latest wonderfood that will help us live longer. We are now relying on science and innovation to help us tackle the new public health challenge that is diet and lifestyle-related diseases such as overweight and obesity.

It's a challenge that many countries are facing. In the last three decades, the levels of overweight and obesity have risen dramatically, particularly among children, and the trend of poor diet and low physical activity is getting even worse. Many chronic conditions such as cancer, cardiovascular diseases, obesity and type 2 diabetes can be prevented or modified through better lifestyles and healthier diets.

Unfortunately, different attempts to encourage healthier eating have not yet led to major changes in patterns of food purchase and consumption. That's where a multidisciplinary approach comes in, with health and nutrition research that includes the social sciences. We all know, for example, that understanding people's behaviours and their relationship to food and exercise is vital in helping them to make healthier choices.

Implementation is important, and this will be achieved first by coordinating national research programmes and activities. In this critical phase of implementation, it is important to unlock national funding for research and to actively engage in aligning national research programmes and innovation policies.

subSections.title: Match the words in Column ‘A’ with their meanings in Column ‘B’.

B.text: to make something suitable for a new purpose
to deal with a difficult problem
to understand or become aware of something

subSections.explanationNepali: यी शब्दहरूको अर्थ पाठको सन्दर्भमा आधारित छन्। 'Tackle' को अर्थ 'सामना गर्नु', 'chronic' को अर्थ 'दीर्घकालीन', 'modify' को अर्थ 'परिमार्जन गर्नु', 'vital' को अर्थ 'अत्यन्त महत्त्वपूर्ण', र 'realize' को अर्थ 'बुझ्नु' हो।
subSections.explanationEnglish: The meanings of these words are based on their context in the text. 'Tackle' means to deal with a problem, 'chronic' means long-lasting, 'modify' means to change for a new purpose, 'vital' means extremely important, and 'realize' means to understand. Citations: chapter 3, pages 42-43; chapter 16, page 260.

subSections.title: Put the following sentences in the correct order.

sentences.text: Unhealthy lifestyles can lead to many preventable chronic diseases.
Understanding human behaviour is key to promoting healthier choices.
Diet and lifestyle-related diseases have become a major public health challenge.
Efforts to encourage healthy eating have not been very successful.
Coordinated national research is necessary for effective implementation of health policies.

subSections.explanationNepali: वाक्यहरूलाई पाठमा विचारहरूको प्रवाह अनुसार क्रमबद्ध गरिएको छ: समस्याको परिचय, समस्याको विस्तार, समाधानको प्रयासको असफलता, नयाँ समाधान, र कार्यान्वयनको लागि कदम।
subSections.explanationEnglish: The sentences are ordered according to the flow of ideas in the text: introduction of the problem, elaboration of the problem, failure of attempted solutions, a new solution, and the step for implementation. Citations: chapter 3, pages 42-44.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is described as a new public health challenge?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Diet and lifestyle-related diseases such as overweight and obesity are described as a new public health challenge.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको पहिलो अनुच्छेदमा "the new public health challenge that is diet and lifestyle-related diseases such as overweight and obesity" भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first paragraph of the text states, "the new public health challenge that is diet and lifestyle-related diseases such as overweight and obesity." Citations: chapter 3, page 42.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Name two chronic conditions that can be prevented with a better lifestyle.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Cancer and cardiovascular diseases can be prevented with a better lifestyle. (Also correct: obesity, type 2 diabetes).
subQuestions.explanationNepali: दोस्रो अनुच्छेदमा "Many chronic conditions such as cancer, ... cardiovascular diseases, obesity and type 2 diabetes can be prevented" भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The second paragraph mentions that "Many chronic conditions such as cancer, ... cardiovascular diseases, obesity and type 2 diabetes can be prevented." Citations: chapter 3, page 43.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why is a multidisciplinary approach necessary to encourage healthier eating?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It is necessary because previous attempts have failed and it is vital to understand people's behaviours and their relationship to food.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ कि "different attempts to encourage healthier eating have not yet led to major changes" र "understanding people's behaviours ... is vital in helping them to make healthier choices," त्यसैले बहु-विषयक दृष्टिकोण आवश्यक छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text notes that "different attempts to encourage healthier eating have not yet led to major changes" and that "understanding people's behaviours ... is vital in helping them to make healthier choices," which is why a multidisciplinary approach is needed. Citations: chapter 3, page 43.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the first step towards implementing health policies effectively?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The first step is coordinating national research programmes and activities.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: अन्तिम अनुच्छेदमा भनिएको छ, "implementation is important, and this will be achieved first by coordinating national research programmes and activities."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The last paragraph states, "implementation is important, and this will be achieved first by coordinating national research programmes and activities." Citations: chapter 3, page 44.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to the text, what is getting worse among children?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The trend of poor diet and low physical activity is getting worse among children.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: दोस्रो अनुच्छेदमा उल्लेख छ कि "the trend of poor diet and low physical activity is getting even worse," विशेष गरी बालबालिकाहरूमा।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The second paragraph mentions that "the trend of poor diet and low physical activity is getting even worse," particularly among children. Citations: chapter 3, page 42.

questions.title: Write a set of rules and regulations to be followed in the school computer lab.

sampleAnswer.title: Rules and Regulations for the Computer Lab
sampleAnswer.content:
All students must follow these rules to ensure a safe and productive learning environment in the computer lab.

1.  Enter the lab quietly and remove your shoes before entering.
2.  No food or drink is allowed near the computers.
3.  Only use the computer assigned to you by the teacher.
4.  Do not change any settings on the computer or install any software.
5.  Always save your work properly on your designated folder or a pen drive.
6.  Remember to log off from your computer before you leave the lab.
7.  If you face any technical problems, report them to the teacher immediately. Do not try to fix them yourself.
8.  Help keep the lab clean by not leaving any papers or personal belongings behind.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले कम्प्युटर ल्याबमा पालना गर्नुपर्ने नियम र विनियमहरूको एक सेट प्रस्तुत गर्दछ, जुन दिइएको संकेतहरूमा आधारित छ। यसले विद्यार्थीहरूलाई शान्तपूर्वक प्रवेश गर्न, जुत्ता खोल्न, खानेकुरा र पेय पदार्थहरू नल्याउन, र तोकिएको कम्प्युटर मात्र प्रयोग गर्न निर्देशन दिन्छ। नियमहरूले सेटिङहरू परिवर्तन नगर्न, काम राम्ररी सेभ गर्न, र बाहिर निस्कनु अघि लग अफ गर्न पनि निर्दिष्ट गर्दछ। अन्तमा, यसले समस्याहरू रिपोर्ट गर्ने र ल्याब सफा राख्ने महत्त्वलाई जोड दिन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents a set of rules and regulations to be followed in a computer lab, based on the clues provided. It instructs students to enter quietly, remove shoes, avoid food and drinks, and use only the assigned computer. The rules also specify not to change settings, to save work properly, and to log off before leaving. Finally, it emphasizes reporting problems and keeping the lab clean. Citations: chapter 4, page 65.

questions.title: Your school is organizing a 'Parents' Day' next week. Write a formal message of invitation to be sent to the parents in about 100 words.

sampleAnswer.title: Invitation to Parents' Day Celebration
sampleAnswer.content:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

You are cordially invited to the annual 'Parents' Day' celebration of our school. The event will be held on Friday, 28th March, 2025, at 11:00 AM in the school auditorium.

The Ward Chairperson has kindly consented to be the chief guest for the occasion. The event will feature various cultural programmes performed by our talented students, followed by the prize distribution ceremony to honour academic and extracurricular achievements.

Your presence is highly anticipated to encourage our students. Kindly confirm your attendance by 25th March, 2025, by contacting the school office so that we can make the necessary arrangements.

We look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
The Principal
ABC School
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले 'अभिभावक दिवस' को लागि अभिभावकहरूलाई पठाइने एक औपचारिक निमन्त्रणा सन्देश प्रस्तुत गर्दछ, दिइएको संकेतहरू प्रयोग गर्दै। यसले कार्यक्रमको मिति, समय, र स्थान स्पष्ट रूपमा उल्लेख गर्दछ। यसले प्रमुख अतिथि, सांस्कृतिक कार्यक्रमहरू, र पुरस्कार वितरण जस्ता मुख्य आकर्षणहरूलाई हाइलाइट गर्दछ। निमन्त्रणाले अभिभावकहरूलाई उपस्थित हुन अनुरोध गर्दछ र व्यवस्थापनको लागि उनीहरूको उपस्थिति पुष्टि गर्न आग्रह गर्दछ, जसले यसलाई एक पूर्ण र औपचारिक सन्देश बनाउँछ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents a formal invitation message to be sent to parents for 'Parents' Day', using the provided clues. It clearly states the date, time, and venue of the event. It highlights the main attractions like the chief guest, cultural programmes, and prize distribution. The invitation requests the parents' presence and asks them to confirm their attendance for arrangement purposes, making it a complete and formal message. Citations: chapter 16, page 265.

questions.title: Many young people in our society prefer fast food over traditional home-cooked meals. Write two paragraphs in about 150 words expressing your views on this trend and its effects.

sampleAnswer.content:
In today's fast-paced world, there is a growing trend among young people to choose fast food over traditional home-cooked meals. This shift is largely driven by convenience, attractive advertising, and the influence of western culture. Fast food restaurants offer quick service, which is appealing to students and young professionals with busy schedules. Additionally, the taste and variety of items like pizza, burgers, and fried chicken are often perceived as more exciting than traditional dishes like 'dal-bhat'. Peer pressure and the desire to socialize in popular fast-food joints also contribute significantly to this trend.

However, the increasing consumption of fast food has several negative effects on the health and culture of our youth. These foods are typically high in calories, unhealthy fats, sugar, and salt, while being low in essential nutrients. Regular consumption can lead to serious health problems like obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. Furthermore, this trend is causing a decline in the appreciation for our own rich and healthy culinary traditions. The practice of families eating together, which is a cornerstone of our culture, is also diminishing as more young people prefer to eat out with friends. It is important to raise awareness about the benefits of traditional food to encourage a healthier lifestyle.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले युवाहरूमा फास्ट फुडको बढ्दो प्रवृत्तिको कारण र प्रभावहरूमा दुई अनुच्छेदमा विचार प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। पहिलो अनुच्छेदले सुविधा, विज्ञापन, र पश्चिमी संस्कृतिको प्रभाव जस्ता कारणहरूलाई सम्बोधन गर्दछ। दोस्रो अनुच्छेदले मोटोपना र मधुमेह जस्ता स्वास्थ्य समस्याहरू, र परम्परागत खाना र पारिवारिक भोजनको संस्कृतिमा ह्रास जस्ता नकारात्मक प्रभावहरूमा केन्द्रित छ। उत्तरले सन्तुलित दृष्टिकोण प्रस्तुत गर्दछ र लगभग १५० शब्दहरूको शब्द सीमाभित्र रहन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents views on the growing trend of fast food among youth and its effects in two paragraphs. The first paragraph addresses the causes, such as convenience, advertising, and the influence of western culture. The second paragraph focuses on the negative effects, including health problems like obesity and diabetes, and the decline in traditional food culture and family meals. The response offers a balanced perspective and stays within the word limit of about 150 words. Citations: chapter 6, page 100.

questions.title: Write a review of a book you have recently read in about 200 words.
clues: analysis of its strengths and weaknesses

sampleAnswer.title: Book Review: Jivan Kada Ki Phul
sampleAnswer.content:
Jivan Kada Ki Phul (Is Life a Thorn or a Flower?), the autobiography of Jhamak Ghimire, is an incredibly powerful and inspiring book. The story chronicles the author's life as a person born with cerebral palsy in a rural Nepali village. Unable to speak, walk, or use her hands, Ghimire learns to write with her left foot, defying all societal expectations and physical limitations to become a celebrated writer. The plot is not just a sequence of events but a profound journey of her struggle, determination, and ultimate triumph against immense adversity.

The greatest strength of the book is its raw and honest narration. Ghimire does not shy away from depicting the pain, neglect, and discrimination she faced, which makes her achievements even more remarkable. Her writing is simple yet deeply moving, allowing readers to connect with her struggles on a personal level. The vivid descriptions of her village life and family dynamics add a rich cultural context. A potential weakness for some readers might be the intense emotional weight of the story; it is a difficult and often heartbreaking read.

I wholeheartedly recommend Jivan Kada Ki Phul to everyone. It is more than just an autobiography; it is a testament to the unbeatable power of the human spirit. The book teaches us about resilience, the importance of education, and the need for empathy. It will leave a lasting impact on anyone who reads it.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले झमक घिमिरेको आत्मकथा 'जीवन काँडा कि फूल' को समीक्षा प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले पुस्तकको शीर्षक, लेखक, मुख्य कथाको सारांश, यसको शक्ति र कमजोरीहरूको विश्लेषण, र एक सिफारिस समावेश गर्दछ, जुन प्रश्नमा माग गरिएको थियो। समीक्षाले घिमिरेको संघर्ष र दृढतालाई हाइलाइट गर्दछ, उनको लेखनको इमानदारीलाई पुस्तकको मुख्य शक्तिको रूपमा उल्लेख गर्दछ। यसले पुस्तकको भावनात्मक गहनतालाई सम्भावित कमजोरीको रूपमा पनि स्वीकार गर्दछ। अन्त्यमा, यसले मानव आत्माको शक्तिको प्रमाणको रूपमा पुस्तकलाई दृढतापूर्वक सिफारिस गर्दछ, जुन लगभग २०० शब्दहरूको शब्द सीमा भित्र छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer provides a review of Jhamak Ghimire's autobiography, Jivan Kada Ki Phul. It includes the book's title, author, a summary of the main plot, an analysis of its strengths and weaknesses, and a recommendation, as requested in the question. The review highlights Ghimire's struggle and determination, citing the honesty of her writing as the book's main strength. It also acknowledges the emotional weight as a potential weakness. Finally, it strongly recommends the book as a testament to the power of the human spirit, all within the word limit of about 200 words. Citations: chapter 15, pages 246-248.

questions.title: Reproduce the following sentences as instructed in the brackets.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: She seldom visits her grandparents, __________? (Add a correct question tag.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She seldom visits her grandparents, does she?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'Seldom' एक नकारात्मक शब्द हो, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग सकारात्मक हुनुपर्छ। क्रिया 'visits' (v5) को लागि सहायक क्रिया 'does' प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: 'Seldom' is a negative adverb, so the question tag must be positive. The auxiliary verb for the main verb 'visits' (v5) is 'does'. Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: We are planning a trip for the holidays. (Change into negative.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: We are not planning a trip for the holidays.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'are' (सहायक क्रिया) पछि 'not' थपेर वर्तमान निरन्तर कालको वाक्यलाई नकारात्मक बनाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: A present continuous tense sentence is made negative by adding 'not' after the auxiliary verb 'are'. Citations: chapter 11, page 183.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He had finished his homework before the guests arrived. (Change into 'When' question.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: When had he finished his homework?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'before the guests arrived' भन्ने समय वाक्यांशलाई 'When' ले प्रतिस्थापन गर्न, हामीले भूत पूर्ण कालको संरचना प्रयोग गरेर Wh-प्रश्न बनाउँछौं (Wh-word + had + subject + v3?).
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To ask about the time phrase 'before the guests arrived' using 'When', we form a Wh-question using the past perfect structure (Wh-word + had + subject + v3?). Citations: chapter 18, page 301.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: By next year, they __________ (build) the new bridge. (Use the correct form of the verb 'build' to complete the sentence.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: By next year, they will have built the new bridge.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'By next year' भन्ने वाक्यांशले भविष्यमा एक निश्चित समयसम्ममा पूरा हुने कार्यलाई सङ्केत गर्दछ, जसको लागि भविष्य पूर्ण काल (will have + v3) को प्रयोग आवश्यक हुन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The phrase 'By next year' indicates an action that will be completed by a certain time in the future, which requires the use of the future perfect tense (will have + v3). Citations: chapter 12, page 203.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The teacher said to the students, "Work hard to achieve success." (Change into indirect speech.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The teacher advised the students to work hard to achieve success.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: आदेशात्मक वाक्यलाई अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा परिवर्तन गर्दा, रिपोर्टिङ क्रिया (जस्तै 'advised', 'told') पछि 'to' + infinitive को प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When changing an imperative sentence to indirect speech, the reporting verb (like 'advised', 'told') is followed by 'to' + infinitive. Citations: chapter 3, page 40.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Someone has stolen my bicycle. (Change into passive voice.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: My bicycle has been stolen.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: वर्तमान पूर्ण काल (has + v3) को वाक्यलाई passive voice मा परिवर्तन गर्दा, संरचना 'object + has/have + been + v3' हुन्छ। 'by someone' लाई सामान्यतया हटाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To change a present perfect tense (has + v3) sentence into the passive voice, the structure becomes 'object + has/have + been + v3'. The 'by someone' is usually omitted. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

questions.title: Choose and copy the correct answers from the brackets to complete the given text. (Rewriting the text is not compulsory.)
questions.passage: Once upon a time, there lived (a) _____ (a/an/the/no article) honest farmer in a village. He (b) _____ (is/was/are/were) very poor, but he never complained. He worked hard on his farm every day. One day, while he (c) _____ (worked/was working/had worked/has worked) in the field, he found a pot of gold. He was a very honest man, (d) _____ (was he/wasn't he/is he/isn't he)? (e) _____ (Although/Because/So/In spite of) being poor, he decided to take the pot to the king. The king asked him (f) _____ (how he find/how did he find/how he found/how had he found) the pot. The farmer explained everything. The king was very pleased (g) _____ (by/with/at/for) his honesty. The pot of gold (h) _____ (was given/given/is given/had given) to the farmer as a reward by the king. If the farmer had been greedy, he (i) _____ (will not get/would not get/would not have gotten/had not gotten) such a great reward. The king made the villagers (j) _____ (to understand/understand/understood/understanding) the importance of honesty.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'honest' शब्द 'h' बाट सुरु भए तापनि यसको उच्चारण स्वर ध्वनि /ɒ/ बाट हुन्छ, त्यसैले 'an' प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The word 'honest' begins with a vowel sound /ɒ/, even though it starts with the letter 'h', so 'an' is used. Citations: chapter 7, page 120.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'He' (the farmer) एकवचन हो, र कथा भूतकालमा छ, त्यसैले 'was' सही छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'He' (the farmer) is a singular subject, and the story is in the past tense, so 'was' is the correct verb. Citations: chapter 9, page 147.

gaps.explanationNepali: यहाँ 'while' ले एक लामो कार्य (काम गरिरहेको) लाई जनाउँछ जुन अर्को छोटो कार्य (सुनको भाँडो भेट्टाएको) हुँदा भइरहेको थियो। त्यसैले, भूत निरन्तर काल सही छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The use of 'while' indicates a longer background action (was working) that was interrupted by a shorter action (found a pot of gold). Therefore, the past continuous tense is correct. Citations: chapter 9, page 147.

gaps.explanationNepali: वाक्य "He was a very honest man" सकारात्मक छ र भूतकालमा छ, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग नकारात्मक (wasn't) र सर्वनाम (he) हुनुपर्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The statement "He was a very honest man" is positive and in the past tense, so the question tag should be negative (wasn't) with the corresponding pronoun (he). Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'In spite of' पछि एक संज्ञा वाक्यांश ('being poor') आउँछ र यसले विरोधाभास देखाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'In spite of' is followed by a noun phrase ('being poor') and shows contrast. Citations: chapter 13, page 225.

gaps.explanationNepali: अप्रत्यक्ष प्रश्नमा, Wh-शब्द पछि कर्ता + क्रियाको संरचना हुन्छ, प्रश्नवाचक संरचना होइन।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In an indirect question, the structure is Wh-word + subject + verb, not an interrogative structure. Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'pleased' क्रिया पछि सामान्यतया 'with' preposition आउँछ जब कसैको गुण वा कार्यको कुरा हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The adjective 'pleased' is typically followed by the preposition 'with' when referring to a quality or action of someone. Citations: chapter 15, page 259.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो वाक्य passive voice मा छ, जहाँ सुनको भाँडो (object) लाई किसानलाई (subject) राजाद्वारा दिइएको थियो। भूतकालको लागि passive संरचना 'was + v3' हो।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a passive voice sentence, where the pot of gold (object) was the recipient of the action. The past passive structure is 'was + v3'. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो तेस्रो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), जसले भूतकालको एक असम्भव अवस्थालाई जनाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), which refers to an unreal past condition. Citations: chapter 5, page 80.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'make' को causative रूपमा, यसपछि object ('the villagers') र bare infinitive ('understand') आउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In the causative form with 'make', it is followed by an object ('the villagers') and the bare infinitive ('understand'). Citations: chapter 18, page 307.
